profile.documentation: Entity query operations (i.e. finders) can be denoted by setting the query flag on the modeled operation to true (they do not require any stereotypes).

element.name: SERVICE
element.documentation: Produces a Session EJB facade for the CMP EJB entities.

element.name: IDENTIFIER
element.documentation: Identifies an attribute as an identifier (primary key).

element.name: CREATE_METHOD
element.documentation: Used to tag an EJB create method.

element.name: VALUE_REF
element.documentation: Used to generate an association between an entity and a value object class. Found attributes inside the entity as well as the value object are used to get automatically filled out. The entity will provide the helper method, also for saving a value object to an existing entity.
element.appliedOnElement: A dependency going into a ValueObject and out of an Entity

element.name: AUTOMATIC_KEY
element.documentation: Can be used in class level of an entity. If you set this to true, the class will use an automatic key generation for the defined primary key. Please note: This is currently only available in BEA Weblogic and can not be used with combined primary keys.

element.name: QUERY
element.documentation: Defines a hibernate query expression. Note that it's encouraged to model your query body as an OCL constraint (instead of using this tagged value).
element.appliedOnElement: An Entity operation marked as a query.

element.name: VIEW_TYPE
element.documentation: Defines the view type for a Session EJB.

element.name: TRANSACTION_TYPE
element.documentation: Defines a transaction type for the method.

element.name: TABLE
element.documentation: Defines the relational table name for entity persistence.

element.name: COLUMN
element.documentation: Represents the column name for entity persistence.

element.name: COLUMN_LENGTH
element.documentation: Represents the column length for entity persistence.
